summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from October 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate logistics for the victim to attend an FBI Victim Services meeting in New York and be interviewed by prosecutors, highlighting ongoing victim outreach and investigation efforts after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to arrange a meeting and interview for a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. She is coordinating travel and scheduling.

persons.name: Arden
persons.context: A new client of Gloria Allred who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. She is willing to fly to New York for a victim meeting and to be interviewed by prosecutors.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: An attorney from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office who is scheduled to join a conference call regarding the case.

persons.name: Marianne Wang
persons.context: Attorney whose office is involved in the case; her associate Daniel is joining a call.

connections.description: Allred is representing Arden, a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, and is arranging for her to meet with federal investigators.
Daniel, from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office, is joining Allred on a conference call with prosecutors.
Allred is working with Marianne Wang's law office as co-counsel on the Epstein victim case.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting organized by the FBI's Victim Services for alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. Gloria Allred's client, Arden, is willing to fly to New York to attend.

events.title: Scheduled Prosecutor Interview
events.description: A planned interview between the alleged victim Arden and Assistant U.S. Attorneys, to be held at either the FBI office or Allred's office at 305 Broadway.

events.title: Coordinating Conference Call
events.description: A conference call scheduled for 4:00 PM EST between Gloria Allred, her co-counsel Daniel, and federal prosecutors to discuss the case.

locations: Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg office: 6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500)
305 Broadway, New York, NY (Allred's NY office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
Washington, D.C. (destination for Allred's train travel)
keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred informed federal prosecutors in October 2019 that she had a new client, 'Arden,' who was an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The alleged victim was willing to fly to New York to attend an FBI Victim Services meeting scheduled for October 23, 2019.

The emails show active coordination between a victim's attorney and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for victim interviews and logistics, indicating an ongoing investigation.
The correspondence highlights the role of the FBI's Victim Services in handling travel logistics for victims participating in the investigation.
The emails are heavily redacted, with the names of the federal prosecutors and FBI agents involved concealed, indicating sensitive law enforcement communications.
